name: Abbey Gargoyles
text: Flying, protection from red
flavor: "Though Serra has not been seen for twenty years, her Gargoyles still watch over our city and punish the guilty."\n—Gulsen, Abbey Matron

name: Abbey Matron
text: {W}, {T}: Abbey Matron gets +0/+3 until end of turn.
flavor: "The Matrons are kindly souls, but don't ask one for an ale."\n—Halina, Dwarven Trader

name: Abbey Matron
text: {W}, {T}: Abbey Matron gets +0/+3 until end of turn.
flavor: "The Matrons still say Serra is coming back. I bet she never even existed."\n—Murat, Death Speaker

name: Æther Storm
text: Creature spells can't be cast.\nPay 4 life: Destroy Æther Storm. It can't be regenerated. Any player may activate this ability.
flavor: "I do love the rain . . . but this storm feels somehow wrong, Taysir."\n—Daria

name: Aliban's Tower
text: Target blocking creature gets +3/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: "The people of Aysen built their roads with stones from these wonders. Aliban would be pleased with their ingenuity."\n—Baki, Wizard Attendant

name: Aliban's Tower
text: Target blocking creature gets +3/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: "Those who hide in hollow towers would do well to remember the rain."\n—Reyhan, Samite Alchemist

name: Ambush
text: Blocking creatures gain first strike until end of turn.
flavor: "Don't these goons have anything better to do?"\n—Joskun, An-Havva Constable

name: Ambush Party
text: First strike, haste
flavor: "The roads to Koskun Keep are mostly safe these days. Mostly."\n—Joskun, An-Havva Constable

name: Ambush Party
text: First strike, haste
flavor: "Call it a cost of doing business. The best way to protect against thieves is to hire better thieves."\n—Eron the Relentless

name: An-Havva Constable
text: An-Havva Constable's toughness is equal to 1 plus the number of green creatures on the battlefield.
flavor: "Joskun and the other Constables serve with passion, if not with grace."\n—Devin, Faerie Noble

name: An-Havva Inn
text: You gain X plus 1 life, where X is the number of green creatures on the battlefield.
flavor: "The Inn was ever a steady source of good cheer and kindness. Greatly do I miss it, now that I am gone."\n—Ihsan's Shade

name: An-Havva Township
text: {T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.\n{1}, {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.\n{2}, {T}: Add {R} or {W} to your mana pool.
flavor: Folk of good heart will always find a home.

name: An-Zerrin Ruins
text: As An-Zerrin Ruins enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.\nCreatures of the chosen type don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
flavor: "The An-Zerrins have served me well, ever since I first killed them."\n—Baron Sengir

name: Anaba Ancestor
text: {T}: Another target Minotaur creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: "The Ancestors are the wisdom of the tribe and the soul of the Homelands. I am eternally in their debt."\n—Taysir

name: Anaba Bodyguard
text: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
flavor: "Not all Minotaurs are tribal. Some are freelance."\n—Eron the Relentless

name: Anaba Bodyguard
text: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
flavor: "Not someone to pick a fight with, unless you're fond of pain."\n—Halina, Dwarven Trader

name: Anaba Shaman
text: {R}, {T}: Anaba Shaman deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
flavor: "Few master the powers of the earth as well as do the Shamans of the Minotaurs."\n—Baki, Wizard Attendant

name: Anaba Shaman
text: {R}, {T}: Anaba Shaman deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
flavor: "The Shamans? Ha They are mere craven cows not capable of true magic."\n—Irini Sengir

name: Anaba Spirit Crafter
text: Minotaur creatures get +1/+0.
flavor: "The Spirit Crafters sing of all our people. They sing of those lost, of those found, and of those who are yet to be."\n—Onatah, Anaba Shaman

name: Apocalypse Chime
text: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Apocalypse Chime: Destroy all nontoken permanents originally printed in the Homelands expansion. They can't be regenerated.
flavor: "One day, or another, perhaps I shall ring my pretty chime . . . loudly, so that all may hear."\n—Grandmother Sengir

name: Autumn Willow
text: Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)\n{G}: Until end of turn, Autumn Willow can be the target of spells and abilities controlled by target player as though it didn't have shroud.
flavor: "We must shake her limbs and rattle her brains."\n—Grandmother Sengir

name: Aysen Abbey
text: {T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.\n{1}, {T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.\n{2}, {T}: Add {G} or {U} to your mana pool.
flavor: Serra's gift to her people: a symbol of faith and hope.

name: Aysen Bureaucrats
text: {T}: Tap target creature with power 2 or less.
flavor: "I would say that our Bureaucrats are no better than vipers—but I shouldn't insult the vipers."\n—Murat, Death Speaker

name: Aysen Bureaucrats
text: {T}: Tap target creature with power 2 or less.
flavor: "All the tortures of my vault of horrors pale in comparison to dealing with those petty Bureaucrats."\n—Baron Sengir

name: Aysen Crusader
text: Aysen Crusader's power and toughness are each equal to 2 plus the number of Soldiers and Warriors you control.
flavor: "A renegade rallying the rabble does not a true Crusader make."\n—Irini Sengir

name: Aysen Highway
text: White creatures have plainswalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Plains.)
flavor: "Tread the roads of righteousness, Murat, lest you lose your way and be consumed."\n—Baris, Serra Inquisitor

name: Baki's Curse
text: Baki's Curse deals 2 damage to each creature for each Aura attached to that creature.
flavor: "Those who fling spells too quickly should have reason to regret it."\n—Baki, Wizard Attendant

name: Baron Sengir
text: Flying\nWhenever a creature dealt damage by Baron Sengir this turn dies, put a +2/+2 counter on Baron Sengir.\n{T}: Regenerate another target Vampire.
flavor: "Beast. Defiler. The source of all my pain." —Ihsan's Shade

name: Beast Walkers
text: {G}: Beast Walkers gains banding until end of turn. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
flavor: "The Beast Walkers do a great service to Aysen. As humans or as beasts, their heart is yet to Serra true."\n—Baris, Serra Inquisitor

name: Black Carriage
text: Trample\nBlack Carriage doesn't untap during your untap step.\nSacrifice a creature: Untap Black Carriage. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
flavor: "The Baron's drivers are also driven."\n—Chandler

name: Broken Visage
text: Destroy target nonartifact attacking creature. It can't be regenerated. Put a black Spirit creature token with that creature's power and toughness onto the battlefield. Sacrifice the token at the beginning of the next end step.

name: Carapace
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets +0/+2.\nSacrifice Carapace: Regenerate enchanted creature.
flavor: "The tougher to crack, the sweeter the snack."\n—Kakra, Sea Troll

name: Carapace
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets +0/+2.\nSacrifice Carapace: Regenerate enchanted creature.
flavor: "Now, that's a fashion statement."\n—Devin, Faerie Noble

name: Castle Sengir
text: {T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.\n{1}, {T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.\n{2}, {T}: Add {U} or {R} to your mana pool.
flavor: Where hope has no champion, evil rules all.

name: Cemetery Gate
text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)\nProtection from black
flavor: "It keeps some out, yes. It also keeps others in"\n—Grandmother Sengir

name: Cemetery Gate
text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)\nProtection from black
flavor: "Just the place for a picnic."\n—Murat, Death Speaker

name: Chain Stasis
text: You may tap or untap target creature. Then that creature's controller may pay {2}{U}. If the player does, he or she may copy this spell and may choose a new target for that copy.
flavor: "Here we go again."\n—Kakra, Sea Troll

name: Chandler
text: {R}{R}{R}, {T}: Destroy target artifact creature.
flavor: "Never brag about the latest wonder you've created, students. Chandler might be listening."\n—Reveka, Wizard Savant

name: Clockwork Gnomes
text: {3}, {T}: Regenerate target artifact creature.
flavor: "Until I came to the Floating Isle, I never had to oil the servants."\n—Baki, Wizard Attendant

name: Clockwork Steed
text:
Clockwork Steed enters the battlefield with four +1/+0 counters on it.
Clockwork Steed can't be blocked by artifact creatures.
At end of combat, if Clockwork Steed attacked or blocked this combat, remove a +1/+0 counter from it.
{X}, {T}: Put up to X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Steed. This ability can't cause the total number of +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Steed to be greater than four. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

name: Clockwork Swarm
text:
Clockwork Swarm enters the battlefield with four +1/+0 counters on it.
Clockwork Swarm can't be blocked by Walls.
At end of combat, if Clockwork Swarm attacked or blocked this combat, remove a +1/+0 counter from it.
{X}, {T}: Put up to X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Swarm. This ability can't cause the total number of +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Swarm to be greater than four. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

name: Coral Reef
text: Coral Reef enters the battlefield with four polyp counters on it.\nSacrifice an Island: Put two polyp counters on Coral Reef.\n{U}, Tap an untapped blue creature you control, Remove a polyp counter from Coral Reef: Put a +0/+1 counter on target creature.

name: Dark Maze
text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)\n{0}: Dark Maze can attack this turn as though it didn't have defender.  Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.
flavor: "Stray not into the path of darkness, or be lost forever."\n—Baki, Wizard Attendant

name: Dark Maze
text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)\n{0}: Dark Maze can attack this turn as though it didn't have defender.  Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.
flavor: "The path of faith is fortunately fraught with failure."\n—Irini Sengir

name: Daughter of Autumn
text: {W}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to target white creature this turn is dealt to Daughter of Autumn instead.
flavor: "Those who say that Serra is dead have never met the Autumn Willow's daughters. They are as kind and as generous as Serra would wish us to be."\n—Gulsen, Abbey Matron

name: Death Speakers
text: Protection from black
flavor: "Such innocent little birds. They sing a sweet song, sitting on their fragile branch."\n—Grandmother Sengir

name: Didgeridoo
text: {3}: You may put a Minotaur permanent card from your hand onto the battlefield.
flavor: "Play the song of he who delivered us. Play the song of Feroz."\n—Onatah, Anaba Shaman

name: Drudge Spell
text: {B}, Exile two creature cards from your graveyard: Put a 1/1 black Skeleton creature token onto the battlefield. It has "{B}: Regenerate this creature."\nWhen Drudge Spell leaves the battlefield, destroy all Skeleton tokens. They can't be regenerated.

name: Dry Spell
text: Dry Spell deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.
flavor: "Wherever water is lacking, all things suffer."\n—Autumn Willow

name: Dry Spell
text: Dry Spell deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.
flavor: "My soul thirsts for Serra's salvation, as does my body for life's breath."\n—Ihsan's Shade

name: Dwarven Pony
text: {1}{R}, {T}: Target Dwarf creature gains mountainwalk until end of turn. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
flavor: "I hear Halina's got a pony that can count to six—and likes to eat meat."\n—Chandler

name: Dwarven Sea Clan
text: {T}: Choose target attacking or blocking creature whose controller controls an Island. Dwarven Sea Clan deals 2 damage to that creature at end of combat. Activate this ability only before the end of combat step.
flavor: "No dwarf alive can best one of my crew dead."\n—Zeki, Reef Pirate

name: Dwarven Trader
flavor: "Their definition of ‘fair profit' is certainly novel."\n—Reveka, Wizard Savant

name: Dwarven Trader
flavor: "They wouldn't sell their own families—at least, not for cheap."\n—Zeki, Reef Pirate

name: Ebony Rhino
text: Trample
flavor: "That Rhino would fetch us a tidy sum, Joven. Perhaps it's time to make it ours."\n—Chandler

name: Eron the Relentless
text: Haste\n{R}{R}{R}: Regenerate Eron the Relentless.
flavor: "Eron would be much less of a hassle if only he were mortal."\n—Reyhan, Samite Alchemist

name: Evaporate
text: Evaporate deals 1 damage to each white and/or blue creature.
flavor: "The body is a temple with a foundation of sand."\n—Autumn Willow

name: Faerie Noble
text: Flying\nOther Faerie creatures you control get +0/+1.\n{T}: Other Faerie creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: "Faeries talk all in riddles and tricky bits, ‘cept the Nobles. Now, there's some straight talkers."\n—Joskun, An-Havva Constable

name: Feast of the Unicorn
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets +4/+0.
flavor: "Some delicacies are not to be savored, save by the callous."\n—Baron Sengir

name: Feast of the Unicorn
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets +4/+0.
flavor: "Could there be a fouler act? No doubt the Baron knows of one."\n—Autumn Willow

name: Feroz's Ban
text: Creature spells cost {2} more to cast.
flavor: "Without the protection of Feroz's Ban, I fear the Homelands are lost."\n—Daria

name: Folk of An-Havva
text: Whenever Folk of An-Havva blocks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: "There are those who accept being told what to do, what to think, and what to say. Then there are the Folk of An-Havva."\n—Reyhan, Samite Alchemist

name: Folk of An-Havva
text: Whenever Folk of An-Havva blocks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: "This town's only for good folk. The rest can go to the city."\n—Joskun, An-Havva Constable

name: Forget
text: Target player discards two cards, then draws as many cards as he or she discarded this way.

name: Funeral March
text: Enchant creature\nWhen enchanted creature leaves the battlefield, its controller sacrifices a creature.
flavor: "This party is such fun—but it's a shame to mourn just one."\n—Irini Sengir

name: Ghost Hounds
text: Vigilance\nWhenever Ghost Hounds blocks or becomes blocked by a white creature, Ghost Hounds gains first strike until end of turn.

name: Giant Albatross
text: Flying\nWhen Giant Albatross dies, you may pay {1}{U}. If you do, for each creature that dealt damage to Giant Albatross this turn, destroy that creature unless its controller pays 2 life. A creature destroyed this way can't be regenerated.

name: Giant Albatross
text: Flying\nWhen Giant Albatross dies, you may pay {1}{U}. If you do, for each creature that dealt damage to Giant Albatross this turn, destroy that creature unless its controller pays 2 life. A creature destroyed this way can't be regenerated.

name: Giant Oyster
text: You may choose not to untap Giant Oyster during your untap step.\n{T}: For as long as Giant Oyster remains tapped, target tapped creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step, and at the beginning of each of your draw steps, put a -1/-1 counter on that creature. When Giant Oyster leaves the battlefield or becomes untapped, remove all -1/-1 counters from the creature.

name: Grandmother Sengir
text: {1}{B}, {T}: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor: "Rarely have power and madness been so delightfully wed as they have in our dear Grandmother."\n—Baron Sengir

name: Greater Werewolf
text: At end of combat, put a -0/-2 counter on each creature blocking or blocked by Greater Werewolf.
flavor: "The wolf-things are no mere beasts, but the lieutenants of the Baron."\n—Taysir

name: Hazduhr the Abbot
text: {X}, {T}: The next X damage that would be dealt this turn to target white creature you control is dealt to Hazduhr the Abbot instead.
flavor: "Soon, Serra will return and choose the Abbot's successor, else we are lost."\n—Gulsen, Abbey Matron

name: Headstone
text: Exile target card from a graveyard.\nDraw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
flavor: "Your headstone is the last page in the book of your life."\n—Murat, Death Speaker

name: Heart Wolf
text: First strike\n{T}: Target Dwarf creature gets +2/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn. When that creature leaves the battlefield this turn, sacrifice Heart Wolf. Activate this ability only during combat.

name: Hungry Mist
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Hungry Mist unless you pay {G}{G}.
flavor: "All things must eat, after all. Even the air can hunger."\n—Gemma, Willow Priestess

name: Hungry Mist
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Hungry Mist unless you pay {G}{G}.
flavor: "If the air must feed, let it take the self-righteous."\n—Murat, Death Speaker

name: Ihsan's Shade
text: Protection from white
flavor: "Ihsan, the weak. Ihsan, the fallen. Ihsan, the betrayer. He has brought shame to the Serra Paladins where none existed before. May his suffering equal his betrayal."\n—Baris, Serra Inquisitor

name: Irini Sengir
text: Green enchantment spells and white enchantment spells cost {2} more to cast.
flavor: "That cruel being brings shame to all her fellow Dwarves and misery to all the land. She is Sengir's daughter in spirit if not in blood."\n—Reveka, Wizard Savant

name: Ironclaw Curse
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets -0/-1.\nEnchanted creature can't block creatures with power equal to or greater than the enchanted creature's toughness.

name: Jinx
text: Target land becomes the basic land type of your choice until end of turn.\nDraw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
flavor: "What wizards upset, the land soon rights."\n—Gemma, Willow Priestess

name: Joven
text: {R}{R}{R}, {T}: Destroy target noncreature artifact.
flavor: "Joven, you're almost as good a thief as I. But Eron hates you even more."\n—Chandler

name: Joven's Ferrets
text: Whenever Joven's Ferrets attacks, it gets +0/+2 until end of turn.\nAt end of combat, tap all creatures that blocked Joven's Ferrets this turn. They don't untap during their controller's next untap step.

name: Joven's Tools
text: {4}, {T}: Target creature can't be blocked this turn except by Walls.
flavor: "If that thief Joven ever shows his head around here again, make sure he leaves without it."\n—Eron the Relentless

name: Koskun Falls
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Koskun Falls unless you tap an untapped creature you control.\nCreatures can't attack you unless their controller pays {2} for each creature he or she controls that's attacking you.

name: Koskun Keep
text: {T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.\n{1}, {T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.\n{2}, {T}: Add {B} or {G} to your mana pool.
flavor: Treachery and anarchy make poor partners.

name: Labyrinth Minotaur
text: Whenever Labyrinth Minotaur blocks a creature, that creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
flavor: "Legend says they got a treasure cave, but it don't say where to find it."\n—Zeki, Reef Pirate

name: Labyrinth Minotaur
text: Whenever Labyrinth Minotaur blocks a creature, that creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
flavor: "I doubt any Labyrinth Minotaurs still live—but then again, we Minotaurs are stubborn beings."\n—Onatah, Anaba Shaman

name: Leaping Lizard
text: {1}{G}: Leaping Lizard gets -0/-1 and gains flying until end of turn.
flavor: "I never question the Autumn Willow about her motives, not even when she turns people into Lizards. It's her way."\n—Devin, Faerie Noble

name: Leeches
text: Target player loses all poison counters. Leeches deals that much damage to that player.
flavor: "Where our potions and powders fail, perhaps nature will succeed."\n—Reyhan, Samite Alchemist

name: Mammoth Harness
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature loses flying.\nWhenever enchanted creature blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, the other creature gains first strike until end of turn.

name: Marjhan
text:
Marjhan doesn't untap during your untap step.
{U}{U}, Sacrifice a creature: Untap Marjhan. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
Marjhan can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
{U}{U}: Marjhan gets -1/-0 until end of turn and deals 1 damage to target attacking creature without flying.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Marjhan.

name: Memory Lapse
text: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, put it on top of its owner's library instead of into that player's graveyard.
flavor: "Um . . . oh . . . what was I saying?"\n—Reveka, Wizard Savant

name: Memory Lapse
text: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, put it on top of its owner's library instead of into that player's graveyard.
flavor: "Oh, I had a conscience once. But alas, I seem to have forgotten where I put it."\n—Chandler

name: Merchant Scroll
text: Search your library for a blue instant card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
flavor: "There's no trade without trust."\n—Eron, the Relentless

name: Mesa Falcon
text: Flying\n{1}{W}: Mesa Falcon gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: "Pretty Falcon, friend to Soraya. Will you send her my greetings?"\n—Gemma, Willow Priestess

name: Mesa Falcon
text: Flying\n{1}{W}: Mesa Falcon gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: "The faith of Serra is borne on wings of hope."\n—Gulsen, Abbey Matron

name: Mystic Decree
text: All creatures lose flying and islandwalk.
flavor: "Curse Reveka, and curse her coddled conjurers. Their sorcerers' school shall yet be ours."\n—Irini Sengir

name: Narwhal
text: First strike, protection from red
flavor: "Who needs a spear? Ya break off the horn, and ya stab the fish with it. Easy!"\n—Kakra, Sea Troll

name: Orcish Mine
text:
Enchant land
Orcish Mine enters the battlefield with three ore counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep or whenever enchanted land becomes tapped, remove an ore counter from Orcish Mine.
When the last ore counter is removed from Orcish Mine, destroy enchanted land and Orcish Mine deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

name: Primal Order
text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Primal Order deals damage to that player equal to the number of nonbasic lands he or she controls.
flavor: "It's strange, but I can feel it when the land is corrupted. I understand why the Autumn Willow is so protective."\n—Daria

name: Prophecy
text: Reveal the top card of target opponent's library. If it's a land, you gain 1 life. Then that player shuffles his or her library.\nDraw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

name: Rashka the Slayer
text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)\nWhenever Rashka the Slayer blocks one or more black creatures, Rashka gets +1/+2 until end of turn.
flavor: "Rarely be the prey so haughty as to hunt the hunter."\n—Baron Sengir

name: Reef Pirates
text: Whenever Reef Pirates deals damage to an opponent, that player puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
flavor: "Zeki sails with a dead crew not out of villainy, but pragmatism."\n—Baron Sengir

name: Reef Pirates
text: Whenever Reef Pirates deals damage to an opponent, that player puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
flavor: "Corpses for crew don't sit well with me. Zeki and his dead ship had best keep their distance."\n—Joskun, An-Havva Constable

name: Renewal
text: As an additional cost to cast Renewal, sacrifice a land.\nSearch your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.\nDraw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

name: Retribution
text: Choose two target creatures an opponent controls. That player chooses and sacrifices one of those creatures. Put a -1/-1 counter on the other.

name: Reveka, Wizard Savant
text: {T}: Reveka, Wizard Savant deals 2 damage to target creature or player and doesn't untap during your next untap step.
flavor: "It's nice to see a sister Dwarf in a position of such power, but why'd it have to be one of those seafaring muleheads?"\n—Halina, Dwarven Trader

name: Root Spider
text: Whenever Root Spider blocks, it gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.
flavor: "They're not half as fierce if they don't see you coming."\n—Devin, Faerie Noble

name: Roots
text: Enchant creature without flying\nWhen Roots enters the battlefield, tap enchanted creature.\nEnchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
flavor: "That which nourishes can also bind."\n—Gemma, Willow Priestess

name: Roterothopter
text: Flying\n{2}: Roterothopter gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability no more than twice each turn.
flavor: "The Roterothopter is as insidious as it is ingenious. It is one of the few creations of our school that I take no pride in." —Baki, Wizard Attendant

name: Rysorian Badger
text: Whenever Rysorian Badger attacks and isn't blocked, you may exile up to two target creature cards from defending player's graveyard. If you do, you gain 1 life for each card exiled this way and Rysorian Badger assigns no combat damage this turn.

name: Samite Alchemist
text: {W}{W}, {T}: Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt this turn to target creature you control. Tap that creature. It doesn't untap during your next untap step.
flavor: "Powders and potions are nothing compared to faith."\n—Baris, Serra Inquisitor

name: Samite Alchemist
text: {W}{W}, {T}: Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt this turn to target creature you control. Tap that creature. It doesn't untap during your next untap step.
flavor: "The wisest of Aysen dwell not in the Abbey, but in the laboratory."\n—Taysir

name: Sea Sprite
text: Flying, protection from red
flavor: "No one can catch what won't be caught."\n—Kakra, Sea Troll

name: Sea Troll
text: {U}: Regenerate Sea Troll. Activate this ability only if Sea Troll blocked or was blocked by a blue creature this turn.
flavor: "I've seen those Trolls devour a drowning sailor faster than his lungs could fill with water."\n—Zeki, Reef Pirate

name: Sengir Autocrat
text: When Sengir Autocrat enters the battlefield, put three 0/1 black Serf creature tokens onto the battlefield.\nWhen Sengir Autocrat leaves the battlefield, exile all Serf tokens.
flavor: "A thankless job, and a death sentence besides."\n—Eron the Relentless

name: Sengir Bats
text: Flying\nWhenever a creature dealt damage by Sengir Bats this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Bats.
flavor: "In the face of every one I see the Baron."\n—Daria

name: Sengir Bats
text: Flying\nWhenever a creature dealt damage by Sengir Bats this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Bats.
flavor: "They are the eyes of the Baron, and they know your fears."\n—Ihsan's Shade

name: Serra Aviary
text: Creatures with flying get +1/+1.
flavor: "Serra, like Feroz, is long since dead. But remember, Daria: her spirit shall survive so long as the Homelands do."\n—Taysir

name: Serra Bestiary
text: Enchant creature\nAt the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Serra Bestiary unless you pay {W}{W}.\nEnchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities with {T} in their costs can't be activated.

name: Serra Inquisitors
text: Whenever Serra Inquisitors blocks or becomes blocked by one or more black creatures, Serra Inquisitors gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

name: Serra Paladin
text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.\n{1}{W}{W}, {T}: Target creature gains vigilance until end of turn.
flavor: "Would that I could be a Paladin again, but the dead hold no place among their ranks."\n—Ihsan's Shade

name: Serrated Arrows
text: Serrated Arrows enters the battlefield with three arrowhead counters on it.\nAt the beginning of your upkeep, if there are no arrowhead counters on Serrated Arrows, sacrifice it.\n{T}, Remove an arrowhead counter from Serrated Arrows: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.

name: Shrink
text: Target creature gets -5/-0 until end of turn.
flavor: "The smallest beast can yet have the greatest heart."\n—Gemma, Willow Priestess

name: Shrink
text: Target creature gets -5/-0 until end of turn.
flavor: "Do not fear adversity. Let your courage be your strength."\n—Onatah, Anaba Shaman

name: Soraya the Falconer
text: Bird creatures get +1/+1.\n{1}{W}: Target Bird creature gains banding until end of turn. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding a player controls are blocking or being blocked by a creature, that player divides that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
flavor: "Soraya speaks with the hunters of the air, as do all of her family line."\n—Autumn Willow

name: Spectral Bears
text: Whenever Spectral Bears attacks, if defending player controls no black nontoken permanents, it doesn't untap during your next untap step.
flavor: "I hear there are Bears—or spirits—that guard caravans passing through the forest." —Gulsen, Abbey Matron

name: Timmerian Fiends
text: Remove Timmerian Fiends from your deck before playing if you're not playing for ante.\n{B}{B}{B}, Sacrifice Timmerian Fiends: The owner of target artifact may ante the top card of his or her library. If that player doesn't, exchange ownership of that artifact and Timmerian Fiends. Put the artifact card into your graveyard and Timmerian Fiends from anywhere into that player's graveyard. This change in ownership is permanent.

name: Torture
text: Enchant creature\n{1}{B}: Put a -1/-1 counter on enchanted creature.
flavor: "Oh, they scream, right enough, and plead, too—but the Baron keeps no mercy in his vault of horrors."\n—Zeki, Reef Pirate

name: Torture
text: Enchant creature\n{1}{B}: Put a -1/-1 counter on enchanted creature.
flavor: "It helps you pass the time until you die."\n—Grandmother Sengir

name: Trade Caravan
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a currency counter on Trade Caravan.\nRemove two currency counters from Trade Caravan: Untap target basic land. Activate this ability only during an opponent's upkeep.

name: Trade Caravan
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a currency counter on Trade Caravan.\nRemove two currency counters from Trade Caravan: Untap target basic land. Activate this ability only during an opponent's upkeep.

name: Truce
text: Each player may draw up to two cards. For each card less than two a player draws this way, that player gains 2 life.
flavor: "The people of Aysen feed us, and we don't kill them. That's my kind of truce."\n—Eron the Relentless

name: Veldrane of Sengir
text: {1}{B}{B}: Veldrane of Sengir gets -3/-0 and gains forestwalk until end of turn. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
flavor: "Poor, foolish Veldrane. He goes wherever the Baron wills him. One day, he'll go to die."\n—Halina, Dwarven Trader

name: Wall of Kelp
text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)\n{U}{U}, {T}: Put a 0/1 blue Plant Wall creature token with defender named Kelp onto the battlefield.
flavor: "Ya can eat it or ya can weave it, but ya can't fight in it."\n—Zeki, Reef Pirate

name: Willow Faerie
text: Flying
flavor: "The Autumn Willow cannot be everywhere at once—that's what her grandchildren are for."\n—Gulsen, Abbey Matron

name: Willow Faerie
text: Flying
flavor: "Swift as the wind and harder to catch— that's the Faeries for you."\n—Daria

name: Willow Priestess
text: {T}: You may put a Faerie permanent card from your hand onto the battlefield.\n{2}{G}: Target green creature gains protection from black until end of turn.
flavor: "Those of faith are those of strength."\n—Autumn Willow

name: Winter Sky
text: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, Winter Sky deals 1 damage to each creature and each player. If you lose the flip, each player draws a card.

name: Wizards' School
text: {T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.\n{1}, {T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.\n{2}, {T}: Add {W} or {B} to your mana pool.
flavor: The legacy of Feroz lives on.
